knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

## Read in CSV

```{r}
movie = read.csv("IMDB_data_fall_2023.csv")
attach(movie)
```

```{r}
summary(movie)
```

```{r}
summary(movie$imdb_score)
```

## Data Exploration - Plots

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
require(methods)
```

```{r}
hist(imdb_score, breaks = 100, col = "skyblue")
```

```{r}
boxplot(movie_budget, col = "orange", boxwex = 0.5)
title("Boxplot for movie_budget Variable")
```
```{r}
hist(duration, breaks = 100, col = "skyblue")
```
```{r}
plot(movie$movie_budget, movie$imdb_score, col = "grey", main = "imdb_score VS budget", xlab = "movie_budget", ylab = "imdb_score")
```
```{r}
plot(movie$duration, movie$imdb_score, col = "grey", main = "imdb_score VS duration", xlab = "duration", ylab = "imdb_score")
```
```{r}
plot(movie$nb_faces, movie$imdb_score, col = "grey", main = "score VS nb_faces", xlab = "nb_faces", ylab = "imdb_score")
```

```{r}
boxplot(actor1_star_meter, col = "orange", boxwex = 0.5)
title("Boxplot for actor1_star_meter Variable")
```
```{r}
plot(movie$actor1_star_meter, movie$imdb_score, col = "grey", main = "score VS actor1_star_meter", xlab = "actor1_star_meter", ylab = "imdb_score")
```
